speaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series
text: Nathan Lane  * * *  ## Transcript {andrea day}    _ACT ONE  Scene One -- Cafe Nervosa. Frasier is seated at a table.  Niles walks in and is about to shut the door when he spots a woman behind him.  He graciously holds the door open for her. _

speaker: Niles
text: Allow me.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series

speaker: Niles
text: You're welcome. [_hangs up coat and walks over to Frasier_] When did everyone become so boorish? [_wipes down chair_] Honestly, sometimes I think I'm the only person left in the world with any sense  of refinement. [_sits_] Ooh! Ooh! Smell my hands!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, no.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm just so proud. I had to stop for gas, and I pumped it myself! [_smells his hands and grimaces_] It's part of a new kick I'm on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Which is what?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm learning to be handy.  I've decided I depend too much on other people, so I'm doing it myself. [_holds out his hand_] Ooh, feel that.  Tell me that's not the start of a first-rate callus.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, you left this in your booth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear, thank you Roz.

speaker: Niles
text: What is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's a tape Dad asked me to rent for him.  It's part of our new Wednesday night ritual.  Dad mixes up a pot of his five-alarm chili, we all curl up on the couch and watch an Angie Dickinson movie and I wish I were dead.  You should join us.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  I got my first work shirt this morning and tonight I'm tackling the squeaky hasp on my cigar humidor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, be sure to wear your hernia belt.  So, Roz, you gonna join us?

speaker: Roz
text: [_pointedly at Niles_] No, I think I'll just go sit over here.

speaker: Niles
text: Roz?  Are you trying to avoid me?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, can you blame me?  I mean, it took you nearly a year just to learn my name and every time we sit together, you have some kind of snide remark to make.

speaker: Niles
text: Name one.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, last week you told me my bedroom was easier to get into than a community college.

speaker: Niles
text: I was hoping that would be the one you'd name.

speaker: Roz
text: [_charging at him_] You know, I've got half a mind to...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no!  Just hold on now, Roz.  You and Niles got off on the wrong foot a long time ago.  I think if you two sat down and had a real conversation you'd hit it off famously.  Here, you sit, Roz, and I will go and get your coffee.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pause_] So, how are you?

speaker: Roz
text: Fine.  You?

speaker: Niles
text: Great. [_pause_] I'm handy now. [_Roz stares at him_] So...that's a nice jacket.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Offbeat.

speaker: Roz
text: And what is that supposed to mean, "offbeat"?

speaker: Niles
text: Well...

speaker: Roz
text: No, wait, I think I know exactly what it means.  Offbeat as in cheap.  Well, excuse me for not being rich enough to shop at the International House of Tight-Ass like you and Maris the heiress!  That is what you meant, right?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes... but I had no idea you'd pick up on it!

speaker: Roz
text: Then you were insulting me.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but you got in a couple of good shots yourself.

speaker: Roz
text: I did, didn't I?  I'm so glad we did this!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, sometimes I am such a good therapist, I scare myself! [_notices_] Oh my goodness... where's my briefcase?

speaker: Niles
text: Didn't you put it under your chair?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes I did, but someone must have taken it!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, look, there it is! _Niles points to a man walking towards the door, carrying a briefcase. Frasier rushes to the door to block the man from leaving._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Man
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that your briefcase?

speaker: Man
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where did you get it?

speaker: Man
text: Some of the nuns in my parish bought it for me as a gift.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, your parish?  Then that would make you a priest?

speaker: Man
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, "Father" [_grabs the briefcase_], perhaps you'd like to explain why you'd be carrying around... [_opens the case_]...a Bible and some rosary beads?! [_slams the case shut_]

speaker: Man
text: What exactly are you looking for?

speaker: Frasier
text: An Angie Dickinson movie.  I loaned it to the Monsignor.  He was supposed to give it to you to give to me.  Apparently he forgot.  Well, it's a two-day rental anyway, doesn't matter. Off you go.  Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, Frasier.  It looked exactly like yours.  They both have the same inferior leather.

speaker: Roz
text: I gave him that briefcase!

speaker: Niles
text: [_playfully punching her shoulder_] I know! **IT'S LIKE HORATIO** _Scene Two - Frasier's apartment. Frasier is seated at the dinner table, on the phone to the police. Eddie is in Martin's chair, staring at Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I would mind holding again!  Look, I've already held three times!  I'm simply trying to report a few stolen credit cards, but every five seconds...damn it! [_He notices Eddie staring_] Don't stare at me, Eddie.  I'm a humane man, but right now I could kick a kitten through an electric fan! _Eddie jumps down and runs off down the hall as Martin and Daphne enter.  They ad-lib hellos._

speaker: Martin
text: So, Niles called.  Somebody stole your briefcase, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right, Dad, go ahead; tell me how stupid I was to get taken advantage of that way.  It's certainly better than listening to "Jumping Jack Flash" arranged for piano and flute.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't think it was stupid.  These guys are pros.  They just need a second and bam, they're out the door.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's rather refreshing.  I was expecting you to call me every name from a naive dupe to a...

speaker: Martin
text: Bone-headed rube?

speaker: Frasier
text: But you're not!

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm not.  The important thing is you learned a lesson. You got to keep your guard up.  The world would be a happier place if everybody would remember two little words: People stink.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, but that's just a little cynical for me!  I don't want to go through life thinking the worst of people.  I prefer to think of them as basically good and decent. [_into phone_] Yes, I am here, but you know, I'm sorry, I'm in the middle of a speech right now, so you'll have to hold! [_places phone on hold_] Truth is, I enjoy my life that way. If the price I have to pay is to replace a few credit cards from time to time, well then, so be it.

speaker: Daphne
text: This whole thing reminds me of when I first moved to London. I was very mistrusting of people back then.  I was convinced the way to stay out of harm's way was to walk straight with me eyes cast down, never meeting anyone's glance.  But, finally, I decided that was no way to live.  So one day, I just lifted up my chin and took it all in.  Well, the change was amazing.  There were sights I'd never seen, sounds I'd never heard.  A tiny old man came up to me with a note in his hand.  He needed help.  I realized this was no city full of thieves and muggers.  There were people here who needed me. I took his note, read it, and to this day, I can remember just what I said to that Man: "That's not how you spell �fellatio.'"

speaker: Frasier
text: So... whose point did she prove?

speaker: Martin
text: I have no idea. _FADE TO:  Scene Three - KACL. The next day.  Frasier is finishing up his show._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I can't tell you how much fun it's been chatting with you all today, nasty old Gertrude aside.  But, I'd like to close the show with a personal message.  This goes out to the person who stole my briefcase yesterday.  And, as it turns out, also stole my dry cleaning this morning with the claim ticket that was inside.  You need help, and I am here to provide it.  Oh, also, the double-breasted navy blue suit was meant to be worn with French cuffs and medium heel wing tips.  You may be sick, but there's no reason why you shouldn't be stylish.  Until tomorrow, this is Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Roz
text: Man, that was a great show!  It was better than great - it was brilliant.  I can't remember when you were more...

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you want?

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  Remember, I told you my girlfriend was coming to town and I might need Friday off?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Roz
text: No, you don't remember, or no, I can't have Friday off?

speaker: Frasier
text: Take one of each, I'm feeling generous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?

speaker: Man
text: [_v.o._] Hi, is this Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Man
text: Oh man, what a thrill!  I can't believe I got through!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, actually, my show is over.  You'll have to call in again tomorrow.

speaker: Man
text: That's not why I'm calling.  I think I found your briefcase.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?  Really, are you sure?

speaker: Man
text: Pretty sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's a way we can be positive.  Simply turn over the briefcase and in the upper right-hand corner you should find a half-moon-shaped watermark, such as would be left by the careless resting of a champagne flute.

speaker: Man
text: It's full of your stuff, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Well, that works as well, yes.  Say, listen, is everything still there?

speaker: Man
text: Well, there's a nice gold pen, a set of car keys, a date book...

speaker: Frasier
text: What about my wallet?

speaker: Man
text: Oh, sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose that was asking for too much.  Well, how can I get it back?

speaker: Man
text: I could drop it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, better yet, why don't you meet me at the Cafe Nervosa on Pike and Third.  I'd be glad to give you a reward.

speaker: Man
text: Hey, meeting you is reward enough!  Half an hour okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's perfect.  Bye.

speaker: Man
text: Bye.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, that was pretty great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but not surprising.  Haven't I always told you to have faith in people?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, and you were right.  People are basically good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: And fair.

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed.

speaker: Roz
text: We do nice things for people in this world because there's a little thing called karma...

speaker: Frasier
text: There's no way you're getting Friday off. _He walks out into the hallway, with Roz whining "Why?" behind him.  FADE TO:  Scene Four -- Cafe Nervosa. Frasier is waiting at the counter.  Niles enters and holds the door open for a pretty blonde woman. _

speaker: Niles
text: Allow me. _As before, the woman breezes past him without a word. He walks over to Frasier in a huff._

speaker: Niles
text: Do you believe that woman?  That's the second time that's happened to me this week.  I have half a mind to say something.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then why don't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know.  Something happens to me when I talk to a beautiful woman.  From the moment they begin staring into my eyes my knees turn to jelly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Still, Niles, we both know the only way to break people off their bad habits is by confronting them.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's true.

speaker: Frasier
text: So? [_gestures toward the woman_]

speaker: Waiter
text: Who's next here?

speaker: Woman
text: **[_cutting off Niles_] I am! I'll have a cafe...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, oh, oh!  No, you're not!  You weren't next here, I am! [_turns to face her_] I suppose people like you who glide through life wrapped in a cozy little cocoon of narcissism never notice such things.  But you'd do well to learn this lesson, sister! [_beginning to wobble_] There's still such a thing as good manners in this world, and that's why I would like to insist that you let me buy you your coffee and also please try the poppy seed muffins.

speaker: Woman
text: ** Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: You're welcome. _He places some money on the counter and then staggers to a table, unsure of what just happened._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] Kind of brutal, weren't you?

speaker: Niles
text: All I remember was, I was next and then the sound of blood thundering through my ears.

speaker: Frasier
text: There, there, Niles.  Soon you'll be home with Maris and you'll forget you were anywhere near a beautiful woman today. [_moves toward the window seat_] Please, why don't we sit here by the window so we can see him when he comes?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, your good Samaritan?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  You know, I have to tell you Niles, I'm feeling rather good about this whole thing.  Granted, I did lose my wallet and my favorite suit.  But, still, mostly everything else was intact.  My date book, my spare set of car keys, my fountain pen.  But, best of all, what has remained intact is my sense that people are basically trustworthy.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, the person who has your car keys asked you to meet him here, knowing you'd bring your car?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now... before you launch into one of your little paranoid riffs, my car happens to be...[_looks out the window_] MOVING DOWN THE STREET!!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my god! [_o.s._] Stop!  Stop that well-dressed man! _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene One - Frasier's apartment. Later that evening. Niles sits on the couch, drinking coffee while Martin is on the phone with an old cop buddy of his._

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Charlie, it's my son Frasier's car.  So, if you could put a little extra manpower on this, I'd appreciate it. Yeah, I know.  I know, fell for that old scam. [_Niles exits to the kitchen_] I told him you gotta keep your guard up, but you know Frasier, he always knows better - Mr. Up With People.  Yeah, remember what we used to call guys like him when I was on the force? [_laughs, then_] Hey, we're still talking about my son here, Charlie!  Yeah, I'll talk to you.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi Frasier, how's it going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Terribly.  Guess what happened today?

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: My car was stolen!

speaker: Martin
text: [_pretending_] You're kidding!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, once again, I fell victim to a master criminal.

speaker: Martin
text: How'd they do it?  Hot-wire it?  Boy, you know, those guys got fingers like concert pianists.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  He had the key.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, a real pro, huh?  He made a wax impression and then had a duplicate key made?

speaker: Frasier
text: No... It was the same miscreant who stole my briefcase.  He used the spare set that was inside.

speaker: Martin
text: What?  He tailed you for a few days, learned your routine, so he'd know where to find the car?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sheepishly_] Not exactly.  He called the station and we agreed to meet.

speaker: Martin
text: What for?

speaker: Niles
text: [_entering from the kitchen_] Low-fat lattes and biscotti.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what are you, the town crier?!  Oh, go ahead and laugh! You know, it still doesn't shake my belief in the basic goodness of people.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, sure.  He's probably using your car to deliver hot meals to shut-ins. [_he and Niles laugh again_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I'm glad that my misfortune has given you two so much glee!  But Dad, I have two requests.  First, wipe that father-knows-best smirk off of your face!  I am not a child!

speaker: Martin
text: And, what's the second request?

speaker: Frasier
text: Can I borrow your car?  I want to go to the movies. _Niles and Martin continue laughing as the scene fades out.  FADE TO:_ **BRIEFCASE OF LOVE** _Scene Two - KACL. Frasier is giving Daphne a tour of KACL before his show begins._

speaker: Frasier
text: And last stop on our tour, my booth.  Where all the magic happens.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey Daphne, what are you doing here?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane needed a lift in, so I decided to come up for a little tour.  Oh, don't mind me.  Just go on about your business. _She stoops over his console, holds his headphones to her ear, and talks into the microphone._

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not like... I'm listening. [_giggles_]

speaker: Roz
text: Have we had one visitor yet who _didn't_ feel the need to do that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you for the ride down, Daphne, but we do have a show to do.  So if you...

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, people are always telling me I have a natural talent for this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, of course.  Your soothing voice, your calming manner. [_walks her to the door_] I could listen to you for hours.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, wow, do you really think so?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  Absolutely.  All right, now get out. [_shoves her out the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, could you get that, please?

speaker: Roz
text: Sure. [_in phone_] Hello?  Who's calling please?  Just a second. [_to Frasier_] It's Denise.  She said she was out with you last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wasn't out with anyone named Denise last night.

speaker: Roz
text: Ooh... speaker phone, speaker phone!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right. [_places it on speaker phone_] Hello.  This is Frasier Crane.

speaker: Denise
text: [_v.o._] Hey, tiger.  I miss you already.

speaker: Frasier
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, I'm sorry to call you at work, but you just snuck out of here this morning without giving me your number and I woke up to see your BMW pulling down my driveway.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizing_] You did?

speaker: Denise
text: Mm-hmm.  But I'm not mad.  How can I be after the best first night I ever spent with a man?

speaker: Frasier
text: Denise, could you just hold on for a moment?

speaker: Denise
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you realize what this means?

speaker: Roz
text: The guy who stole your stuff told her he was you.

speaker: Frasier
text: And it worked!  She slept with him on the first date!  Nobody ever sleeps with me on the first date! [_takes phone off hold_] Hi, it's me again.

speaker: Denise
text: Look, I'm sorry to do this on short notice, but I won't be able to meet you for that drink at Alberto's.  The agency called.  They booked me for a swimsuit layout.

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, there's my cab.  I'll call you tomorrow.  Kisses! [_hangs up_]  [_N.B. The celebrity who plays Denise is uncredited._]

speaker: Roz
text: Unbelievable!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Apparently he wasn't content just to steal my possessions.  Now he's after my identity as well!

speaker: Roz
text: [_picking up phone_] I'm calling the police.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz, no!  I will handle this myself.  I am going down to Alberto's.

speaker: Roz
text: You have a show!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just run something from the "Best of Frasier Crane."  This jackal thinks he's meeting Denise down there, but he's going to meet me instead!

speaker: Roz
text: Are you crazy?!  He could be dangerous!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't care, Roz!  My god, this man's gone too far.  He's after my very soul now!  What was it Shakespeare wrote?  "He who steals my purse steals trash.  But he who steals my good name steals..."  Well... oh, I forget the rest, but it makes me good and mad! _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Alberto's. Frasier enters Alberto's just as two men are leaving.  He quickly looks them over to see what they are wearing.  He then approaches a woman, Heather, seated at the bar._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me.  Have you seen a man in here wearing an impeccably tailored Italian suit?

speaker: Heather
text: Just you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_blushes_] Oh, well... thank you.  Giorgio Armani.

speaker: Heather
text: Nice to meet you, Giorgio. [_they laugh_] My name's Heather.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, uh, Frasier Crane, it's a pleasure. [_gestures to a barstool next to her_] Do you mind?

speaker: Heather
text: Wait a minute.  Dr. Frasier Crane from the radio?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Heather
text: Well, I've heard your show.  You're great!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Heather
text: This is exciting! [_pauses_] Hey, didn't you say on your show the other day that someone had impersonated you at the dry cleaners?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, someone did.

speaker: Heather
text: But, how do I know that you're not the impersonator?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good heavens, if you're looking for identification, I... [_reaches for his wallet_] Uh-oh.

speaker: Heather
text: I thought so. [_gets up to leave_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but, he stole my wallet the other day.

speaker: Heather
text: Who did?

speaker: Frasier
text: Frasier did - the bad Frasier.

speaker: Heather
text: You're pretty sick, you know that?  Maybe you ought to just get a life!

speaker: Frasier
text: Heather, this is absurd! Can't you recognize my... _She's gone before he can get the chance to explain further. He stands at the door for a moment, defeated.  Then, a man enters the bar.  He is nowhere near Frasier's size, but Frasier recognizes the suit.  He slowly looks the man up and down as the man grows more and more nervous._

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice suit.

speaker: Phil
text: Oh my god, it's you! _We recognize his voice as the man who called in to Frasier's show. He rushes to the door, but Frasier catches him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no you don't!  You're mine now!

speaker: Phil
text: All right.  All right, I give up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn it!  How did you find me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, a certain Denise called the station today.  She had to cancel your little rendezvous.

speaker: Phil
text: Great.  And I put on my best suit.

speaker: Frasier
text: No. You put on _my_ best suit!

speaker: Phil
text: Well, I guess this is it.  Party's over.  I'm so stupid! [_sits at a table_] You probably want to call the police, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  What I would like to do is throttle you until your eyes shoot across the room like champagne corks!  But I won't, because this is still a civilized world.  But it won't be for long if you lowlifes have your way, because with every wallet you steal, you put bars on someone else's windows! With every purse you snatch, you put mace on another key chain!  Everyday you make our lives a little less livable, and I hope that burns on your conscience!  Well, what do you have to say for yourself?

speaker: Phil
text: You're right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh... I see.  I see.  You think by agreeing with me, I'll let you off the hook.

speaker: Phil
text: No, I'm saying you're right.  I'm not trying to weasel out of this.  I'm guilty and I deserve what I get.  Look, here's your keys.  The car's out front with your briefcase in it. [_pulls out a cell phone_] Here, go ahead and call the police.  That's your new car phone, by the way.  I upgraded.  I should have known things were gonna turn out like this for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, here it comes - the old sob story.  "Daddy didn't love me.  Mother ignored me.  The bully next door stole my baseball glove."

speaker: Phil
text: No!  Dad loved me.  Mom spoiled me.  And I _was_ the bully next door. [_gesturing to the phone_] Say, why don't you let me do that, it's kind of tricky.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Phil
text: There's only one person to blame for my problems and that's me. [_into phone_] Yeah, hi.  The number for the Seattle P.D., please. [_to Frasier_] I take the easy way out of everything, I always have.  And you want to know why?  I'm lazy.  Lazy, lazy, lazy! [_into phone_] Oh, sweetheart, I don't have the energy to look for a pencil.  Could you just connect me? Thanks, hon.

speaker: Frasier
text: You expect me to believe that your entire life of crime can be attributed to your laziness?

speaker: Phil
text: Hey, it's the truth.  I don't like to work, never have.  And believe me, it's a lot easier to take something than to get a job.  And I'm even a lazy criminal!  A briefcase here, a set of car keys there.  Maybe a little light shoplifting, but a bank robbery?  All that planning and split-second timing? Forget it!  And that second-story stuff - the grappling hooks, glass cutters... who does that?! [_into phone_] Yeah, thank you. [_hands phone to Frasier_] You're on hold.

speaker: Frasier
text: Story of my week.  You know, you seem to be taking this awfully well.

speaker: Phil
text: Well, it's like I said.  It was bound to happen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Or perhaps... perhaps you wanted to get caught.

speaker: Phil
text: Huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, think about it.  You've been taking greater and greater risks.  Isn't that the behavior of a man who wants to get caught?

speaker: Phil
text: I'm telling ya, Doc - lazy! [_lifts up his leg_] Look at your pants, for god's sake!  You'd think I'd take them in to be hemmed, right?  Staples!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_horrified_] Oh, dear god!

speaker: Phil
text: Staples!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I still say that you really wanted to get caught. [_sits_] It's a classic cri de couer.

speaker: Phil
text: Cri de what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a ballet, it... it just means that you don't like the life that you're living.

speaker: Phil
text: Well, it's not a great life.  Half the time I don't know where my next month's rent is coming from.  And I haven't been in a solid relationship in I don't know how long.

speaker: Frasier
text: Then why don't you change?

speaker: Phil
text: Haven't we been over this? [_shouting_] Gimme an "L", gimme an "A"...

speaker: Frasier
text: As a psychiatrist, I just don't buy that.  You're not lazy. What you are is afraid.  There are any number of things you could do in a legitimate world.  You're just afraid to try one of them and fail at it.

speaker: Phil
text: You really think I can change?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  I believe everyone can change because I believe in the basic goodness of people. [_into phone_] Oh yes, hello.  Yes, uh...just a moment, please. [_to Phil_] Start now.  Take responsibility for yourself. [_offers the phone to him_] For once, don't take the easy way out.

speaker: Phil
text: [_into phone_] Hello.  Yeah, I'd like to report a crime. _Frasier looks pleased with himself.  Suddenly, Heather, the woman from the bar, returns with a couple of police officers._

speaker: Heather
text: [_pointing at Frasier_] There he is.  He's the man who's been impersonating Frasier Crane. Officer: All right, let's go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what are you talking about?  I _am_ Frasier Crane! Officer: Do you have identification?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no... no.  But it's the truth! [_to Phil_] Tell them.

speaker: Phil
text: Thank god you got here when you did, officer!  I detained him as long as I could!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?! Officer: [_grabbing Frasier's arm_] Move it!

speaker: Frasier
text: But he's lying!  He's the imposter!  Don't you people recognize me?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for goodness sake!  This is madness!  I can't believe this is happening! [_shouting_] People of the world, listen to me!  Trust no one, especially THAT lazy bastard!
